DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Evaluate impact BRCA1/BRCA2 testing among member hereditary breast-ovarian cancer family . - Evaluate long-term impact genetic counseling test psychosocial behavioral outcome . - Evaluate relative impact standard genetic counseling ( SGC ) versus SGC plus interactive decision-aid ( IDA ) medical decision-making . - Evaluate relative impact SGC v SGC + IDA psychological well-being . - Explore mechanism SGC + IDA intervention impact psychosocial behavioral outcome . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Eligible woman ask participate baseline telephone interview 30 minute invite genetic counseling session 1.5-2 hour include information BRCA1/2 testing . Patients offer BRCA1/2 testing , test result ( i.e. , mutation carrier v noncarrier ) present subsequent in-person individual genetic counseling session 1.5-2 hour . Patients test positive BRCA1 2 mutation randomize 1 2 counseling arm . All patient proceed follow . - Arm I ( standard genetic counseling ) : No counselor-initiated contact schedule . - Arm II ( individualize decision aid ) : Patients ask view interactive computer program design help patient make medical decision base breast cancer risk . Outcome assessment , include quality life assessment , conduct 2 , 6 , 12 month . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 950 patient accrue study .
